alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 9:34PM PST until January 15 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow above 4000 feet. Additional snow accumulations 2 to 5 inches with amounts up to 10 for Sawyers Bar Road near Mt. Etna and on Grayback Road north of Happy Camp. Winds will gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Mountains in western Siskiyou County above 4000 feet, mainly west of the Scott Valley. This includes higher portions of Grayback Road north of Happy Camp and higher portions of Sawyers Bar Road. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Very low visibilities may occur, especially as snowfall rates peak Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are expected to lower from 4500 to 4000 feet during the afternoon, then will remain near 4000 feet tonight. Snowfall rates may reach 1 inch per hour at times today into tonight. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
